TopicTitle: 1.0.5 -- Double right-click in flight will lock the mouse to camera drag mode

Articles.Content:
Total new install of KSP 1.0.5 on Windows 7, 64Bit, graphics card is "NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti" with latest drivers as of time of writing.

KER (v1.0.18.0) is the *only* mod I have installed.

To reproduce the bug...

Launch a simple vessel and then move the mouse to an empty area of sky and perform a double-RIGHT-mouseclick, then release all mouse buttons.

Symptoms...

Moving the mouse around is as if the *MIDDLE* mouse button is held down.

Workaround...

One more RIGHT click fixes it.

Other thoughts...

I never had this problem before in other versions and I do tend to hammer the RMB a lot to make sure all menus are closed before I do delicate stuff with the mouse.

Severity...

Mild annoyance, no big deal.

Edited November 11, 2015 by wossname
This is not a bug, but a new feature, as stated in the Changelog.

Then how do we get rid of the multitude of stacked menu items easily?

- - - Updated - - -

Also:

KER mod uses the "\" key to show and hide the KER windows. This key also seems to trigger this unpleasant mouse-camera interaction.

Is this also expected behaviour?
Probably just change the keybindings in the KER setting .cfg will solve the issue.
I think there is a checkbox in general settings
